fields.description: NetX Duo requires ThreadX RTOS as mandatory dependency for thread execution, timers, and synchronization. Provides real-time operating system foundation for embedded network stack operations.
System requires 5-45 KB ROM and 1-5 KB RAM minimum for operation. Provides memory-efficient TCP/IP stack suitable for resource-constrained embedded systems.
Network stack must support both IPv4 and IPv6 protocols with configurable single-stack builds. Enables modern network connectivity while maintaining backward compatibility for legacy systems.
Core transport protocols TCP and UDP with congestion control and Fast Path Technology. Provides reliable and unreliable transport layer services for application protocols.
Packet-based zero-copy implementation prevents data copying within the stack. Maximizes performance and reduces CPU overhead for embedded network processing.
Achieve 95 Mbps UDP and 93 Mbps TCP throughput on 100 Mbps Ethernet at 100MHz MCU. Delivers near-wire-speed performance for demanding embedded network applications.
Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol for automatic IP address assignment with client and server modes. Enables plug-and-play network configuration for embedded devices.
Transport Layer Security (TLS 1.0/1.1/1.2) and Datagram TLS for secure communications. Provides encryption and authentication for TCP and UDP traffic in IoT applications.
Message Queuing Telemetry Transport protocol for IoT messaging with minimal footprint. Enables lightweight publish-subscribe communication for connected devices.
HTTP 1.0/1.1 and HTTPS client/server support with persistent connections and multipart uploads. Provides web connectivity for device management and data transfer.
Domain Name System client for hostname resolution with mDNS and DNS-SD capabilities. Enables name-based addressing and service discovery in embedded networks.
Configurable multiple physical network interface support for multi-homed systems. Allows devices to connect to multiple networks simultaneously with intelligent routing.
Complete implementation in ANSI C for maximum portability across processor architectures. Ensures compatibility with standard C compilers and development toolchains.
Phase II IPv6 Ready Logo certification compliance for interoperability assurance. Validates conformance to IPv6 standards and compatibility with other IPv6 implementations.
IEC 61508 SIL 4 and UL safety standards certification for safety-critical applications. Provides assurance for use in medical devices, automotive, and industrial control systems.
Simple Mail Transfer Protocol client for email sending capabilities. Enables embedded devices to send notifications and status reports via email.
Network Address Translation for IPv4 address sharing and routing. Allows embedded devices to act as gateways and share internet connections.
Simple Network Management Protocol agent support for versions 1, 2, and 3. Enables remote monitoring and management of embedded network devices.
File Transfer Protocol and Trivial FTP client/server support for file operations. Provides file upload/download capabilities for firmware updates and data transfer.
Simple Network Time Protocol client for network time synchronization. Ensures accurate timekeeping for logging, certificates, and time-sensitive operations.
Point-to-Point Protocol and PPP over Ethernet for dial-up and broadband connections. Enables connectivity through various network access methods.
Internet Protocol Security for IP-layer encryption and authentication with IKE v2 support. Provides VPN capabilities and secure network communications.
Telnet client and server for remote terminal access and device management. Enables command-line interface access for embedded device configuration.
Automatic IPv4 address assignment for zero-configuration networking. Enables devices to automatically configure network settings without DHCP server.
Azure IoT Middleware for cloud connectivity and device management integration. Provides seamless connection to Microsoft Azure IoT services and platforms.
Post Office Protocol Version 3 client for email retrieval from mail servers. Enables embedded devices to receive and process email communications.
Support for hardware-based checksum computation and validation to reduce CPU overhead. Optimizes performance by leveraging network controller capabilities.
BSD-compatible socket interface layer for legacy application porting. Facilitates migration of existing network applications to NetX Duo platform.
Optional runtime error checking for performance optimization in production builds. Allows removal of parameter validation overhead when not needed.
Real-time Transport Protocol (RTP) and Real-time Streaming Protocol (RTSP) for media streaming. Enables audio/video streaming capabilities in embedded applications.
Precision Time Protocol (PTP) client for high-accuracy time synchronization in industrial networks. Provides sub-microsecond timing precision for time-critical applications.
Flexible packet pool management with dual pool support and low watermark features. Optimizes memory usage and prevents packet pool starvation in high-traffic scenarios.
IPv6 Stateless Address Autoconfiguration (SLAAC) with neighbor discovery and duplicate address detection. Enables automatic IPv6 address configuration without DHCPv6 server.
Standardized network driver interface for hardware abstraction with ISR-safe operations. Provides consistent API for various network hardware implementations.
IGMP for IPv4 and MLD for IPv6 multicast group management with configurable group limits. Enables efficient multicast communication for group-based applications.
TCP window scaling option for high-bandwidth applications with windows larger than 64KB. Improves TCP performance over high-speed, high-latency network connections.
IP fragmentation and reassembly for both IPv4 and IPv6 with configurable timeout values. Handles packets larger than network MTU for seamless communication.
IPv4 static routing with configurable routing table for complex network topologies. Enables manual route configuration for specific network architectures.
TCP keepalive timer for detecting dead connections with configurable intervals and retry counts. Maintains connection state awareness in long-lived TCP sessions.
Comprehensive cryptographic algorithms including RSA, AES, DES/3DES, ECC, HMAC, MD5, SHA-1/SHA-2. Provides software and hardware crypto support for security protocols.
DHCPv6 client and server for IPv6 address assignment and configuration. Provides stateful IPv6 address configuration as complement to SLAAC.
Optional Path MTU Discovery for IPv6 to determine optimal packet size for network paths. Minimizes fragmentation by discovering largest non-fragmenting packet size.
Azure Device Update for IoT Hub integration for over-the-air firmware updates. Enables secure and reliable remote device updates through Azure cloud services.
Microsoft Defender for IoT security module for malicious network activity detection. Provides behavioral analysis and security monitoring for embedded devices.
UDP Fast Path Technology for optimized UDP packet processing with minimal function call overhead. Maximizes UDP throughput for real-time and streaming applications.
IxANVL automated network validation for protocol compliance testing. Ensures interoperability through industry-standard protocol validation testing.
Optional loopback interface for local communication and testing. Provides standard localhost functionality for application development and diagnostics.
Configurable IP thread priority and stack size for real-time scheduling optimization. Allows fine-tuning of network stack priority relative to application threads.
Optional dual packet pool configuration with different payload sizes for memory optimization. Enables efficient memory usage for mixed small/large packet scenarios.
WebSocket protocol support for real-time bidirectional web communication. Enables modern web application connectivity with low-latency messaging capabilities.
System must depend on ThreadX real-time kernel and use ThreadX APIs for threading, synchronization, and memory management. Core requirement for all NetX functionality.
System must implement NX_PACKET_POOL with configurable packet sizes and counts for network buffer management. Essential for network packet allocation and deallocation.
Code must support both IPv4 and IPv6 protocol stacks with unified API through NX_IP structure. Enables dual-stack networking with single interface.
Implementation must provide complete TCP state machine (CLOSED, LISTEN, SYN_SENT, ESTABLISHED, etc.) with window scaling and keepalive support. Critical for reliable TCP connections.
System must implement lightweight UDP socket support with port binding and receive queue management. Required for connectionless communication protocols.
Code must implement Address Resolution Protocol for IPv4 with ARP cache management and probe functionality. Essential for Ethernet-based IPv4 networking.
System must support Internet Control Message Protocol for both IPv4 and IPv6 including ping, error reporting, and neighbor discovery. Required for network diagnostics and IPv6 functionality.
Implementation must provide NX_INTERFACE structure supporting multiple network interfaces with capability flags and driver binding. Enables multi-homed networking.
Code must use conditional compilation macros (NX_*_ENABLE) to allow selective feature inclusion. Critical for memory-constrained embedded systems.
System must provide DHCP client with state machine, lease management, and optional BOOTP support. Essential for automatic IP configuration.
Implementation must support MQTT v3.1.1 protocol with QoS levels, subscription management, and optional TLS security. Required for IoT messaging.
Code must implement DNS client for hostname resolution with IPv4/IPv6 support and caching. Essential for name-based network connections.
System must provide HTTP protocol implementation with chunked encoding, authentication, and optional WebSocket upgrade. Required for web-based communication.
Implementation must provide NX_SECURE_TLS with multiple cipher suites, certificate validation, and session management. Critical for secure communications.
Code must implement crypto algorithms including AES, RSA, ECC, SHA, and MD5 for security operations. Essential for encryption and authentication.
System must support IPSec with ESP and AH protocols when NX_IPSEC_ENABLE is defined. Required for network-layer security.
Implementation must provide Network Address Translation with port mapping and connection tracking. Required for gateway and router applications.
Code must support IGMP for IPv4 and MLD for IPv6 multicast group membership. Essential for group communication applications.
System must handle Ethernet, VLAN tagging, and generic link layer protocols with driver abstraction. Critical for various network media support.
Implementation must support hardware TCP/IP offload when NX_ENABLE_TCPIP_OFFLOAD is defined. Required for high-performance networking hardware.
Code must implement IP fragmentation and reassembly for both IPv4 and IPv6 protocols. Essential for handling MTU limitations.
System must maintain comprehensive network statistics counters for protocols, interfaces, and error conditions. Required for network monitoring and debugging.
Implementation must provide thread-safe APIs with proper locking mechanisms for multi-threaded applications. Critical for concurrent network access.
Code must abstract hardware-specific details through nx_port.h with endianness handling and timer definitions. Essential for cross-platform portability.
System must provide Azure IoT client with device twin, telemetry, and direct method support. Required for Azure IoT connectivity.
Implementation must support WebSocket protocol with frame parsing and optional compression. Required for real-time web applications.
Code must implement SNTP client for network time synchronization and optional PTP support. Essential for time-critical applications.
System must provide callback mechanisms for security events, connection state changes, and error notifications. Critical for application-level security monitoring.
